description: The operator `standardize_datetime` aims to standardize the datetime format. We use the operator by specifying the arguments `column` and the format string `format`. Remember, only use the operators to standardize datetime-value column.
demos:
/*
"date": "october 19" | "july 13 2009" | "september 23 governor's cup"
*/
Requirement: please standardize the column `date` to datetime format.
Operator: ```standardize_datetime(df, column='date', format='%B %d %Y')```

/*
"kickoff": "7:05pm" | "3:05pm" | "7:35pm" | "7:05pm" | "7:05pm"
*/
Requirement: please standardize the column `kickoff` to datetime format.
Operator: ```standardize_datetime(df, column='kickoff', format='%I:%M%p')```

/*
"date": "1958" | "july 20, 1953" | "1950" | "1950" | "1948" | "1948"
*/
Requirement: please standardize the column `date` to datetime format.
Operator: ```standardize_datetime(df, column='date', format='%B %d %Y')```
